messages.message:
Probably the customer has enabled some URL-blocking feature in their email provider, which directly strips out the URLs in the email. Please take a look at my comments in this ticket for more details (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1238).
To fix this, we can ask the client to add instabase domain to their allowlist in their email provider's URL-blocking setting.

I second what Xindi just said.
Also, this should be fixed in later releases: https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/CS-3861
I shouldn't say "fixed" so much as "there's a workaround for this"
@Weiming Wu we also found that Outlook was smart in that it recognized URLs in plain text as URLs (probably just checking the text content against regex) and removed it :cry:
